message.content:
cs.CR, cs.AR, cs.OS, cs.PL, cs.SE 

The paper discusses a technique for improving memory safety in C and C++, which is a common concern in computer security (cs.CR). The paper also describes two existing implementations of memory tagging, which involves hardware and compiler-based tools, making it relevant to computer architecture (cs.AR) and programming languages (cs.PL). The paper also discusses how memory tagging can improve memory safety in operating systems (cs.OS) and software engineering (cs.SE).
